Name: Create Time Bar Code Behind
Description: RadTimeBar supports lightweight batch initialization through the ISupportInitialize interface. You can use the methods of this interface in code behind to create and initialize a time bar before adding it in the visual tree.
KeyWords: Create Time Bar Code Behind,  radareasparkline, isupportinitialize

Name: Custom Interval Types
Events
Description:
You can handle the following events when using the RadTimeBar for a very rich user experience with the control:

· GroupIntervalChanged - Fires when interval groups drill level changed.
· HoveredPeriodChanged - Fires when the time period hovered changes.
· ItemIntervalChanged - Fires when the interval items drill level changed.
· VisiblePeriodChanged - Fires when the period that is currently visible has changed as we scroll and zoom within the control.
· SelectionChanged - Fires when the time period selected has changed.

Name: Hide Selection Range Title
Description: The purpose of this topic is to demonstrate how you may hide the range title that is visible with selection range. This will be achieved with completely implicit styles instead of the old way of styling which was used in Styling Items and Groups example.
KeyWords: Hide Selection Range Title,  selectionthumbstyle, issnaptointervalenabled

Name: Localization
Description: The built-in localization mechanism in Silverlight and WPF (which is available since Q2 2011) allows you to localize any string resource used by the standard RadTimeBar control. Once translated you might use your resources in both Silverlight and WPF projects without changing anything.

Name: MVVM support
Description: The Telerik RadTimeBar control can be used with great success with the Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM) pattern. This help topic will demonstrate how to use the control with the pattern.

Name: RadTimeBar overview
Description: The RadTimeBar is a time bound DataVisualization control. Its chief purpose is to allow lightweight scrolling and navigation through large periods of time. Additionally, the control exposes intuitive API which allows for both declarative and programmatic manipulation of the control.

Name: RadTimeBar properties
Description: There is a required precedence of the TimeBar's properties. This means that the Start Time should always be set before the End Time. A required precedence of Properties is given in this example.
KeyWords: RadTimeBar properties,  issnaptointervalenabled, minselectionrange, maxselectionrange, visibleperiodstart, visibleperiodend, intervalspans

Name: Scroll Modes
Description: The ScrollMode property of RadTimeBar configures the horizontal scrolling and zooming behavior of the control.

Name: Special Slots
Description:
The purpose of this topic is to demonstrate how you may use the special slots feature of RadTimeBar. It provides the following four samples:
	
	-WeekDaysGenerator - It demonstrates a customizable slot, where the first day and the duration of the period can be set.
	-WorkDaysGenerator - It is a specific case of the WeekDaysGenerator, where the period Monday to Friday is marked for every week.
	-WeekendGenerator - Similarly to the WeekDaysGenerator, Saturday and Sunday are marked.
	-MonthDayGenerator - It is a customizable slot, where you have a reccuring day once in the month. For instance, every 15th day of the month.

Name: Styling Items And Groups
Description: This section is intended to give you a broad understanding of the possible way in which you can customize the visual appearance of the RadTimeBar.
KeyWords: Styling Items And Groups,  issnaptointervalenabled, radareasparkline, style

Name: Time Bar Over Chart View
Description:
The example demonstrates one possible approach for implementing a mixed functionality between TimeBar and ChartView. One way to achieve this goal is to set the chart to be the Content of the time bar, but this way the chart grows in size when zooming and the virtualization optimizations do not work.
This is why simply overlaying them and syncing the visible period is a much more preferred solution.
KeyWords: Time Bar Over Chart View,  radverticaldataaxis, databinding, lineseries, sliderstyle, chartview

Name: Timeline inside TimeBar
Description: The example demonstrates how a RadTimeline control can be added as content of a RadTimebar control.
KeyWords: Timeline inside TimeBar,  timelineitemgroupspanel, databinding, timelineitemcontainer
